Key Match Events: Dumfries scored for the Netherlands in the 83rd minute to equalize the score at 1-1
Varga scored for Hungary in the 13th minute
Sallai scored for Hungary in the 32nd minute
Fiola scored for the Netherlands in the 77th minute
Pre-Game Insights: The Netherlands have a stellar Nations League away record, having prevailed in each of their last four games, scoring multiple goals each time.
Hungary have strung together a fabulous sequence of home results - nine wins and two draws from their last 11 games.
The Netherlands and Germany are locked together on overall and head-to-head points, but the Netherlands' inferior goal difference means they are currently settling for second place in Group 3.
Hungary are yet to find their shooting boots in the Nations League, scoring just twice in their three Euro 2024 fixtures and only managing a goalless draw with Bosnia-Herzegovina on matchday two.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Puskas Arena in Budapest, Hungary.
The Netherlands have a lot to live up to entertainment-wise after two high-scoring contests in September.
Hungary have not posed much of a threat up front for a few months.
Others: The Netherlands' predicted starting lineup included Virgil van Dijk and Micky van de Ven, who could make their first appearance together.
Hungary's predicted starting lineup included Denes Dibusz and Dominik Szoboszlai.
The match was a UEFA Nations League Group A3 fixture.
